entry.def: An adornment is something that is used to make a person or thing more beautiful.

example.ex: It was a building without any adornment or decoration.
example.tran: 这是一幢没有任何装潢或粉饰的大楼。

entry.def: Adornment is the process of making something more beautiful by adding something to it.

means.word_mean: 1. a decoration of color or interest that is added to relieve plainness
2. the action of decorating yourself with something colorful and interesting

auth_sentence.content: Loan deals lined up for deadline-day adornment Overwhelming.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Loan deals lined up for deadline-day adornment Overwhelming.

auth_sentence.content: There was limited food in the apartment some muesli and other scraps in the kitchen, whose only adornment was an old radio.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: There was limited food in the apartment some muesli and other scraps in the kitchen, whose only adornment was an old radio.

auth_sentence.content: But, beyond adornment, what draws the eye to the Louboutin foot is its silhouette.
auth_sentence.res_content: But, beyond adornment, what draws the eye to the Louboutin foot is its silhouette.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But, beyond adornment, what draws the eye to the Louboutin foot is its silhouette.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 不加修饰的,[文体等]朴素的
stems_affixes.word_buile: in不+ornate充满装饰的→不装饰的
orn装饰+ate……的→adj.华美的,充满装饰的
sub在下面+orn装饰→在下面装饰[别人]→贿赂
